intro: Stomatanthes africanus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's structure and chemical composition make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
